titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Leonard S. Marcus Papers
titlestmt.author: Stephanie Bredbenner

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 03:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection documents the work of Leonard S. Marcus, including the research, writing, and publication of books, articles, and other short works; work as contributing editor and children's literature reviewer at Parenting magazine; the curation of exhibitions at the New York Public Library and Eric Carle Museum for Picture Book Art; and trusteeship of the Eric Carle Museum of Picture Book Art. The collection also contains Marcus's personal and professional correspondence and small amounts of photographs, publishing promotional materials, historic book and toy catalogs, posters, and other printed ephemera. Includes audio recordings and notes from Marcus's interviews with prominent children's literature authors, illustrators, and publishers, including Maurice Sendak, Judy Blume, and Madeleine L'Engle.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research. Boxes 70-90 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information. Boxes 69, 91 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Cumberland Rare Books on the Jockey Hollow Fund, 2015; and gift of Leonard S. Marcus (Yale 1972), 2016.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two groupings: September 2015 Acquisition and August 2016 Acquisition.

bioghist.head: Leonard S. Marcus (1950- )
bioghist.p: Leonard S. Marcus (1950- ) (Yale 1972) is an American critic and scholar of children's literature. Marcus received a bachelor's degree in history from Yale University in 1972, a master's degree in fine arts from the University of Iowa Graduate Writers Workshop in Poetry in 1974, and an honorary doctorate of human letters from Bank Street College of Education in 2007.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Leonard S. Marcus Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit. This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing. This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the work of Leonard S. Marcus, including the research, writing, and publication of books, articles, and other short works; work as contributing editor and children's literature reviewer at Parenting magazine; the curation of exhibitions at the New York Public Library and Eric Carle Museum for Picture Book Art; and trusteeship of the Eric Carle Museum of Picture Book Art. The collection also contains Marcus's personal and professional correspondence and small amounts of photographs, publishing promotional materials, historic book and toy catalogs, posters, and other printed ephemera. Includes audio recordings and notes from Marcus's interviews with prominent children's literature authors, illustrators, and publishers, including Maurice Sendak, Judy Blume, and Madeleine L'Engle.

A significant portion of the papers documents Marcus's research, writing, and publication of Margaret Wise Brown: Awakened by the Moon (Morrow, 1992), a biography of Goodnight Moon author Margaret Wise Brown. Includes papers pertaining to Marcus's other books, including Dear Genius: The Letters of Ursula Nordstrom (HarperCollins, 1998); Author Talk (Simon & Schuster, 2000); Storied City: A Children's Book-Walking Tour Guide to New York City (Dutton, 2003); The Wand in the Word: Conversations with Writers of Fantasy (Candlewick, 2006); Minders of Make-Believe: Idealists, Entrepreneurs, and the Shaping of American Children's Literature (Houghton Mifflin, 2008); Funny Business: Conversations with Writers of Comedy (Candlewick, 2009); Listening for Madeleine: A Portrait of Madeleine L'Engle in Many Voices (Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2012); and Show Me A Story! Why Picture Books Matter (Candlewick, 2012).

The collection also includes papers concerning Marcus's shorter works, including articles, reviews, forewords, and talks. Also present are papers concerning Marcus's work with museums and exhibitions, including The Picture Book Made New: Margaret Wise Brown and Her Illustrators at the Eric Carle Museum of Picture Book Art (2005) and The ABC of It: Why Children's Books Matter at the New York Public Library (2013-2014). Clippings, photographs, audiovisual materials, and electronic media related to Marcus's life and work are present throughout.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: The Leonard S. Marcus Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Cumberland Rare Books on the Jockey Hollow Fund, 2015.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Writings, circa 1981-2015. II. Exhibitions and Museum Work, circa 1985-2013. III. Correspondence, circa 1979-2013. IV. Publishing Promotional Materials and Printed Ephemera, circa 1850-2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents the research, writing, and publication of Marcus's works, including books, articles, reviews, forewords, and talks. Includes research materials, notes, drafts, correspondence, publicity, and clippings. Note that a significant portion of Marcus's research materials consists of duplicates of archival materials held by other libraries. Where possible, the institution holding the originals has been noted. Inquiries about originals of these materials should be directed to the holding institution.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Books and Short Works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents the research, writing, and publication of Marcus's books. Includes research materials, notes, drafts, correspondence, publicity, and clippings. Significant materials concerning Margaret Wise Brown: Awakened by the Moon (Morrow, 1992); Dear Genius: The Letters of Ursula Nordstrom (HarperCollins, 1998); Listening for Madeleine: A Portrait of Madeleine L'Engle in Many Voices (Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 2012); and Minders of Make-Believe: Idealists, Entrepreneurs, and the Shaping of American Children's Literature (Houghton Mifflin, 2008). Note that a significant portion of Marcus's research materials consists of duplicates of archival materials held by other libraries. Where possible, the institution holding the originals has been noted. Inquiries about originals of these materials should be directed to the holding institution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents the research, writing, and publication of Marcus's short works, including articles, forewords, and talks. Includes research materials, notes, drafts, correspondence, publicity, and clippings. A significant portion of the materials concerns Marcus's tenure as contributing editor and children's literature reviewer at Parenting magazine, circa 1987-2008. Note that a significant portion of Marcus's research materials consists of duplicates of archival materials held by other libraries. Where possible, the institution holding the originals has been noted. Inquiries about originals of these materials should be directed to the holding institution.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Night Kitchen Radio Theater, Parenting Magazine, and Other Short Works and Events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents Marcus's work with museums, including exhibitions curated and service on boards of trustees and other advisory boards, particularly Marcus's service on the board of trustees of the Eric Carle Museum of Picture Book Art. Includes research materials, exhibition plans, correspondence, and docent training materials for exhibitions Marcus curated at the New York Public Library, Boston Athenaeum, and Eric Carle Museum of Picture Book Art, amongst others.

did.unittitle: Publishing Promotional Materials and Printed Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publishing promotional material, primarily concerning children's and young adult literature. Includes a small quantity of realia, mostly produced as promotional materials for children's books. Includes other printed ephemera, including historic children's book and toy catalogs, art, posters, and ephemera from events such as the Newbery and Caldecott awards banquets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes recordings and notes from Marcus's interviews with prominent children's literature authors, illustrators, and publishers. Also includes separated digital materials from elsewhere in the collection. Separation sheets for separated electronic media are included in their original locations in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Parenting Magazine, 1989-1995. II. Other Short Works and Events, 1988-2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drafts, notes, and correspondence concerning Marcus's tenure as contributing editor and children's literature reviewer at Parenting magazine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documents the research, writing, and publication of Marcus's short works, including articles, forewords, and talks. Includes research materials, notes, drafts, correspondence, publicity, and clippings.
